labels.analysis: The MCP Server named "WhatTimeIsIt" provides a simple yet essential service of returning the current time based on the client's IP address in ISO 8601 format. This is achieved through a single tool named "what_time_is_it," which leverages the World Time API to provide accurate time data. The server is designed for developers who need lightweight and easy-to-integrate time-checking capabilities for their applications, eliminating the need for complex setups.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Time & Calendar" was chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around providing time-based information, which is directly aligned with scheduling and time management. Additionally, "Geolocation" is included as a secondary label because the server uses the client's IP address to determine the time zone, making it relate to location-based services. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately describe the server's functionality.

tools.name: what_time_is_it
tools.description: Returns the current time string based on the client's IP using World Time API.

server_info_crawled.name: WhatTimeIsIt
server_info_crawled.author: @kukapay/whattimeisit-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Get the current time based on your IP address in ISO 8601 format. Easily integrate time-checking capabilities into your applications with this lightweight server. Perfect for developers needing accurate time data without complex setups.

tools.name: what_time_is_it
tools.description: Returns the current time string based on the client's IP using World Time API.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@kukapay/whattimeisit-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
